description.title: Pathogen: clinical or host-associated sample from Yersinia pseudotuberculosis
description.comment: The following reagent was obtained through the NIH Biodefense and Emerging Infections Research Resources Repository, NIAID, NIH: Genomic DNA from Yersinia pseudotuberculosis, Strain IP2515, NR-4648. This strain belongs to serogroup II and was obtained from a clinical isolate in France. The presence of the virulence plasmid pIB1/pYV in this strain was confirmed by low Ca2+ response prior to deposition.

bioprojects.title: Complete Genome of Yersinia pseudotuberculosis IP2666pIB1

description.title: Complete Genome of Yersinia pseudotuberculosis IP2666pIB1
description.comment: Yersinia pseudotuberculosis, closely related to Yersinia pestis, is a human pathogen and model organism for studying bacterial pathogenesis. To aid in genomic analysis and understanding bacterial virulence, we sequenced and assembled the complete genome of the human pathogen, Yersinia pseudotuberculosis IP2666pIB1.

assembly_info.comments:
Bacteria and source DNA available from laboratory {Bliska, 1991}.
The annotation was added by the NCBI Prokaryotic Genome Annotation Pipeline (PGAP). Information about PGAP can be found here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/annotation_prok/

assembly_info.comments:
Strain NBRC 105693 available from NBRC culture collection (http://www.nite.go.jp/en/nbrc/index.html).

The NBRC Whole Genome Shotgun Project aims to provide "reference genomes" of NBRC culture collection strains for identifying useful genes for taxonomic classification, risk/safety assessment, and industrial application, and for understanding the structure and evolution of microbial genomes.
(http://www.nite.go.jp/en/nbrc/genome/project/wgs/ project_wgs2.html)

assembly_info.comments:
Annotation was added by the NCBI Prokaryotic Genome Annotation Pipeline (released 2013). Information about the Pipeline can be found here: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/annotation_prok/
The following reagent was obtained through the NIH Biodefense and Emerging Infections Research Resources Repository, NIAID, NIH: Yersinia pestis, Strain 125 B. plague Bombay, NR-20

The plasmid name was corrected from pCD1 to pMT1 for LBFK01000022, LBFK01000051, LBFK01000054 and LBFK01000094.
